35948738.review:
ワールド2で心が折れて未クリア。パズルプラットフォーマーと見せかけた死にゲー。
キャラクターの加速度がやたら強く、大量にある即死針の当たり判定がこれまた強いので、ひたすら精密動作を求められる。また微妙に空中判定でジャンプできなかったり、リフトの上で左右調整しないと落ちそうになったりと、どうにもゲームエンジンがパズル向きでない感じがする。
ステージの出来は割とよさそうなので残念。もうちょいパズル要素以外のシビアさを抜いてほしいな...。

31948047.review:
Très bon jeu ! Un petit casse-tête qui ne paie pas de mine au départ (notamment à cause de l'esthétique des menus et l'apparence cheap des sprites), mais la musique fait le reste (très bonne B.O.) et le casse-tête aussi :)
Les contrôles et les hitboxes sont un peu foireux, mais ça reste jouable. 
15/20

26709363.review:
[i][b]The Land of Eyas[/b][/i] est un jeu de plateforme exigeant, dans l'ensemble très bien réalisé, avec une excellente bande son et des mécaniques reposant essentiellement sur la gravité.

Vous incarnez un garçon amnésique nommé [i]Eyas[/i], habillé d'un costume de [strike]tanuki[/strike] chat. Il se réveille dans un monde en ruines, avec pour seul interlocuteur un grand arbre, qui a lui aussi perdu la mémoire. Afin de rentrer chez lui, [i]Eyas[/i] doit récupérer des sortes de pierres éparpillées un peu partout. Des pierres magiques, en réalité, qui possèdent le pouvoir de réveiller les souvenirs. Alors seulement le grand arbre pourra le guider jusqu'à son foyer...

Le monde entier, et donc chacun des quelque 30 niveaux qu'il abrite, est scindé en deux dans le sens de la longueur. La moitié inférieure est occupée par un liquide aux propriétés particulières : la gravité y est en effet inversée. On peut ainsi tomber indéfiniment, du haut vers le bas, puis du bas vers le haut, en passant de l'une à l'autre. Vous saisissez ? Sur son chemin, [i]Eyas[/i] trouvera aussi diverses caisses et flèches : neutres pour les unes, soumises à une gravité fixe pour les autres. Puis des portes fermées à clé, qu'il faudra bien sûr dévérouiller.

Beaucoup d'obstacles en fait, mortels pour la plupart, avec des checkpoints somme toute assez rares, d'où une certaine exigence dans le gameplay : [i][b]The Land of Eyas[/b][/i] possède un côté die & retry indéniable. D'autant qu'il faudra vous accoutumer à la maniabilité particulière du bonhomme. Ces niveaux, dans l'ensemble très variés, proposent un challenge intéressant, qui fera appel à votre jugeote ou à votre habileté ; voire les deux. Le timing sera souvent crucial ! A noter que le jeu se prête très bien au speedrun.

Un seul regret concernant la progression, qui manque parfois de pédagogie. Le jeu entretient un certain... obscurantisme par rapport à une partie des mécaniques dont le joueur pourrait faire usage. Essentiellement, avec les caisses. Aussi je ne saurais trop vous conseiller de vous renseigner (guides, vidéos,...) avant de vous jeter dans le bain.

[h1]Verdict : 3,5/5 - Ce qui est bien, mais pas top.[/h1]

26170486.review: Lead a boy in a cute little cat suit back home, he lost his memory and he needs your help! The Land of Eyas is a beautifully designed platformer, suitable for all ages, failry easy but offers the amount of challenge that's require to keep you running without tossing it away, controls are smooth and the gameplay is fluid, enjoy your quest on returning him back home!

26137152.review: 10/10 loved game defininitly a game for all types of people. Coudnt take my eyes of its great

25659314.review: I was very pleasantly surprised by how easy this game was to get into.  The difficulty level increased almost perfectly as you defeat each level.  Everything about this game is beatifully done.  Even the first time my character defeated was so cute it made me smile and go jump onto the jagged ice a few more times.  Little did I know that I would soon be seeing that on fairly regular basis...  All in all, a great mix of puzzles, reflexes, and beauty.

25619046.review:
The Land of Eyas is a really polished, gravity based 2D puzzle - platformer.

The lore is hidden between the levels and you need to explore the land to understand the story, which is the best way of telling the story to the player.

The art style is great with a really well made soundtrack.  

Game is based on "choose your own level to contiune" and has an ability which most of the 2D platformers lacking,  climbing! 

It also has "timer" feature and all levels has a "time goal" to beat. I might try to speedrun this game at some point.

If you are fan of the platformer genre, you will definetly like this game. I fully recommend it.

25554106.review: The Land of Eyas is an addictive game that brings unique Physics-based concepts, beautiful artwork, and an intriguing plot line together to form pure gaming enjoyment.  You can get lost for hours playing the simple, yet still so complex and difficult, puzzle levels.  It uses a level hub that allows you to play and re-play levels in different orders so if you get stuck on one level you can always try another and come back later.  Each of these levels is a work of art in itself with the beautiful backdrops and the catchy background music.  However, the true glory of this game doesn't come from its pretty looks but rather its unique use of game Physics to enhance the puzzles.  The Land of Eyas uses a gravity-flipping center line to allow you to propel your character around the game board.  This allows levels with puzzles and solutions that your mind has never thought about before.  This creative concept gives a great feeling of satisfaction when you realize what you can jump off to slingshot yourself to the next goal.  The combination of the artwork, this cool gravity concept, and tight gameplay make this a must have game.  Not to mention the replayability that comes in because of the achievements and level times (Gotta get all perfect times!).  I definitely recommend owning this game and losing hours of your time to it.  You won't regret getting lost in The Land of Eyas!

25512622.review:
[b]Disclaimer[/b]: The copy of this game was provided by the developer for review purposes, yet it doesn't affect my review in any way.

[b]Few words about the game[/b]
This game is a cute, little platforming game made by an Indie developer. Your goal is to recover lost memories of a... boy in a cat suit. Yeah, you've read that right. Recover parts of your memory as you go through a bunch of mind-streching levels, where each of them have a twist - there are two gravities! Make new friends and enemies among met creatures, uncover the story that goes along and, if you feel up to the challenge, speedrun your way through the puzzles!

[b]Advantages[/b]
[list]
[*] - Cute graphics and design of the character
[*] - Animations are flawless
[*] - Idea of two gravities is implemented in an interesting way into simple, yet surprising levels full of puzzles
[*] - Simple, basic controls
[*] - Luckily, what's unfortunately shows up alot in games like this one, repetitivness of puzzles is minimal, each level is different with it's layout and graphics design
[*] - Soft sounds, no need to mute the game because of them being irritating
[*] - Easy to navigate around the main menu
[*] - Controller support
[*] - Difficuly of levels is not too hard, yet easy enough to let you keep on going without ragequits
[*] - Beautiful, calm background music
[/list]

[b]Disadvantages[/b]
[list]
[*] - There's a little thing with controls that might feel a bit like an imput lag from time to time, making a character movements react with a little delay
[/list]

[b]Summary[/b]
As you can clearly see, a good game is not always a game with 20 hours long storyline, side quests, amazing '15 3D graphics with antyaliasing. Sometimes, less is more. This game might not reach the top on Steam, but it definitely should be seen by more people. It's perfect to sit back with a controller in hands, hot coffe on a table and relax for a bit. Unless you're an overachiever in here, then have a great fun speedrunning all those levels and getting 100% of achievements, as The Land of Eyas is perfect for it. 

Personal score
[table]
[tr]
[th]
9 / 10
[/th]
[/tr]
[/table]

[i]If you find my review helpful or funny be sure to follow [b]Opium Pulses[/b] curator page right [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/OpiumPulsesNews#curation]here[/url] for more reviewed games![/i]

25502382.review:
I've been playing Land of Eyas for a while, and have streamed it a buncha times in the past for good fun. Its a pretty solid patformer that uses the under-half of the game world as an inverse gravity field, which allows for puzzles that span large vertical spaces to make bigger and better puzzles. If you like the idea of ibb & obb but never have a second player, this game will do more than just scratch the gravity-inversion itch, but probably leave you wanting more!

Storywise the game makes sense - a kid in giant onesie has to feed glaze-encrusted donuts to a very depressed talking tree. They both have trouble remembering stuff, and I kinda wonder if that inverse gravity layer isn't actually too healthy to be around. Then things start to get nasty when the mechanical gears come out too - there's a red room with a conveyor belt that forces players to use profanity to win. 

Seeing all the polish and quality build up and come to fruition has been quite satisfying, and I'm really glad to see the overall result come out so well. Great work, Happy Square!

25469001.review:
Lost with no memory of where he is or how he got there, lead Eyas – a boy in a cat suit – on a quest to get home. But how do you know which way to go when you can’t tell which is up and which is down?

That’s the introduction to this game. The Land of Eyas is essentially a puzzle platform game. I’ll be looking at it primarily from a casual gamer standpoint. Not that I’m actually a casual gamer, but when it comes to platform games, I might as well be.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZKvcpgNWV14

Let’s start first with the nitty-gritty. This is the stuff that any action game and any platform game has to get right or it’s already a non-starter. 

How’s the response? I played with a keyboard. I think platformers are best done with a control pad, but if a game has good keyboard response, chances are it has got good response period. Eyas had good response. I’m comparing this to the rather fussy issues I had when playing Rogue Legacy. I did find the jumping to be a bit “floaty” feeling. As opposed to the “hard” jump of the classic NES Super Mario Bros—if anyone has even played that in the last decade. The sprinting and jumping had the typical response time challenges that I see common in many platformers though, regardless of who is playing them, so I’d say it’s as it’s supposed to be. The type of platforming you’ll do in this game necessitates the type of jump physics that are in the game. Prepare for multiple retries. Thankfully, longer levels have check points.

How’s the performance? I had no frame rate drops on my mid-tier gaming PC. That said, I didn’t get to test on any of the levels that had spinning saw blades, etc. But even so, I’ve seen FPS drops in games on my PC that were less action oriented. So I call this a success as well.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y9WjrKsTCZI

Now that we’ve got the non-starters cleared, how is the game itself? Well, you’ll not find anything revolutionary here. It’s an action puzzle platform game. That’s what you’re going to get. You’re also going to get really beautiful artwork. And that’s what drew me to this game. The boy in the cat suit (Eyas) is cleverly reminiscent of the boy in the white pajamas from Where the Wild Things Are. It’s a savvy decision on the part of the art director. I instantly gravitate to it. The rest of the artwork is crisp, ornate, evocative, and disarming—which is good when your game is a puzzle game and likely to provoke frustration (that’s the nature of the beast). Anything to keep me wanting to look at the game is unequivocally good. I’d almost like to say that artwork is the third rail of platform games these days. Without artwork, what is your platformer bringing to the table that the platformers before it have not already? That Land of Eyas is unapologetically beautiful.

This leads me to the next important aspect of the game: its gimmick. The gimmick is that the force of gravity reverses at the midline of each level. Later levels shake this up further, but this is the core conceit. It looks like a water line. You cross it. Suddenly you find yourself falling up instead of down. It’s not bad as far as gimmicks go, but it’s nothing we haven’t seen before. Does it need to be? What is important is that it adds just enough flexibility to the game that it can present you with some unusual puzzles. So really, I shouldn’t call it a gimmick. That implies that it brings nothing to the table. But it does. It makes you have to look carefully at what’s on your screen to decipher the solution to each level. So really, it’s a game mechanic and it works in favor of the game. Hopefully enough that you find the puzzles in this game to be ones you haven’t seen before. For a casual gamer, I think it succeeds very well. 

The story? Well, there’s not a lot of story to interest me initially. You’re a lost boy talking to a talking tree (yes, I meant to write it that way). You’re looking for “Mother” (Isaac anyone?). I won’t say that I was drawn in instantly or anything. Perhaps as you progress you’ll be more invested in the character(s). I wasn’t. But frankly, I don’t play games any more to read a story, certainly not platformers. Play this game for the puzzles. You won’t be disappointed.

Am I going to get 100’s of hours out of this game? No. It’s not a grand strategy game, is it? But what I will get is enjoyment for my time and a sense of accomplishment in nice bite-size brain packets. I need a nice low-stakes diversion from time to time and Eyas provides that. It even opens multiple levels to choose from so if you get stuck on one, you can solve another and give your brain a rest. This allows you to progress the game until you’re ready for a fresh look at that one level you couldn’t solve yesterday. Again, a very savvy development decision. It circumvents the banging-my-head-against-a-wall feeling many other linear platformers have.

Do I have any criticisms of the game? Is there anything I did not like? Yes. I did get frustrated at times by the deadliness of spikes. Rubbing the side of a crystal doesn’t strike me as an offense that should be punishable by death. I’m not play 1001 Spikes, after all. Yes, that’s a real game. The little “hop” you make at the apex of a moving block was inconsistently implemented and therefore annoying. When you’re riding the elevator block, you want to jump at its highest point. This is not possible though because you “hop” when it gets to that highest point… except in cases when you don’t. Which is it? I want consistency here (you can witness this in my gameplay videos if it isn’t clear). The blocks that you can pick up and carry were a great introduction, but there was a 1 pixel exploit I found where a block was essentially hanging in the air. Not sure I want to complain about that one though considering how hard it was to get that block up there in the first place. None of these things stopped me from enjoying the game, though. I’m a rather fickle gamer, also. So it’s a solid testimony to the game’s strengths that I didn’t give up on its weaknesses.

In the end, I easily recommend this game to someone who wants something fun to do with their brain on a Sunday afternoon.

24544973.review:
(Review code was supplied free of charge by the publishers. TL;DR at the bottom)

The Land of Eyas is a unique and mentally challenging puzzle-platformer developed by Happy Square Productions as a result of a successful Kickstarter campaign. You play as a boy, Eyas, who wakes up in a cat suit in a strange world with no memory and a talking tree who may be able to help him. The game acts as a support group for people like me because I finally feel like someone understands me. Until this game, I thought I was the only person who constantly wakes up in a cat suit, talks to a tree, has difficulty telling which way is up and which way is down, and forgets about what happened the night before. But that all changed with The Land of Eyas. 

As I briefly alluded to before, the unique game mechanic you'll see in The Land of Eyas is the two dimensions that exist in every level. There's this wavy horizontal line that represents the center of gravity, and your character is always pulled to it. So when you fall below it, it pulls you up, and when you're above it, it pulls you down. You'll have to find ways to use this mechanic to your advantage in every level if you hope to make progress in your adventure. This, alongside other game mechanics like building blocks, makes the game require you to take a moment and plot your way to the end of the level. It's not the kind of platformer where you simply make your way onwards - no. The Land of Eyas is a platformer where you'll have to think hard in order to complete the level as you would to solve a math problem. Just as soon as you think that you've mastered the use of the gravity horizon the game will throw more mechanics at you like saw blades and building blocks. You'll constantly have to adapt to these new mechanics in order to continue achieving success.

As if the game wasn't hard enough there are challenges you'll have to complete if you wish to experience everything the game has to offer. Remember that talking tree I mentioned earlier? Well, some levels have seer stones within them that you have to return to the tree in order for him to discover the truth behind his lost memories. These seer stones are often challenging to get and require you to really go out of your way and think even harder than you would to simply complete the level. The levels also display "perfect" times in the top right corner that you may attempt to match or beat, but I don't see any indication that the completion of these challenges in particular will unlock any kind of content.

The soundtrack and sounds in general are also very nice. The music is often fast paced, rushing you onwards and driving you to make mistakes, and sometimes it is mysterious, serving as a reminder of the strange world you've found yourself in. As for the sounds, there's something oddly satisfying about the "thump" you hear when your character lands. Similarly, there's something oddly disturbing about the sound you hear when your character perishes. The music and sounds within are fitting and add to the game wonderfully.

The art style is rather unique and it feels like there is more than one art style throughout the game. You can tell by looking through the screenshots on the Store Page that there are a plethora of different color palletes and environmental themes used throughout the game. There are bright levels, dark levels, cloudy levels, earthy levels, industrial levels...you get the point. Eyas's design is memorable yet it's also a direct copy and paste job of my cat suit. Shameful (/s).

Weaknesses...I suppose it's a good thing that I have to think hard in order to come up with weaknesses. The story is [i]alright[/i] but ultimately I feel like it serves as a backdrop to the gameplay, rather than what urges you to push forward. I haven't completed the story, but at the same time I don't feel motivated whatsoever by it. I wish there were more NPCs to run into and speak with, but they are far and few between. I also wish the game could make me care more about the story in the first place. I really don't care how Eyas got to where he is to be honest, just as I don't really care how and why I wake up in a cat suit occasionally. The only thing motivating me is the challenge of completing all of the levels. I also think you should be able to zoom out whenever you'd like, instead of it doing it automatically at certain points within the level. Furthermore, I wish checkpoints were slightly more plentiful (or better positioned) in some levels, but that's probably just me.

I'm very, very picky when it comes to platformers. I hate the ones that provide an artifical amount of difficulty. I hate the ones where you constantly die and get teleported back to the beginning. That shit gives me motion sickness. But I like The Land of Eyas - I really do. It has a charm and uniqueness about it that I'm drawn to. I like the music in it and I like the freshness each level presents. I never feel like it's getting repetitive as some platformers tend to. I haven't completed the game yet but I certainly plan to, just because I want to see what other game mechanics will be thrown at me. I recommend this game to anyone who enjoys platformers. I see and appreciate the hard work that was put into this game and I wish the developer the best of luck.

[u][b] TL;DR[/b][/u] The Land of Eyas is a charming, challenging game with a touch of mystery. It's unique gameplay and unique world come together to create a memorable experience. While the story falls short, you'll be encouraged to complete the game simply to overcome the challenges it presents. 

[u][b] MachoDan's Bottom Line:[/b][/u] The Land of Eyas gets a 75% or 'C' Rating

(A+) Hot and bothered
(A) Bother
(B) Bother as soon as it’s on sale 
[u][b] (C) Bother only if you like the genre	[/b][/u]
(D) Bother only if you really like the genre
(E) Don’t bother
(F) Bother your state representatives with a letter complaining about the existence of this game 

--

24512634.review:
This game falls just shy of what I would recommend to someone.  The checkpointing needs work (too often there will be a long, dull part before a challenging part, and the checkpoint will be right before the dull part), the momentum of the character takes some getting used to, and the game under-delivers on the promises of its store page.  There aren't much in the way of secrets to uncover, and at least one set of them doesn't have any payoff for having found them all. Lastly, the story is trite, and doesn't really relate to your character or your place in the game-world around you (it doesn't help explain anything about the game, instead being thinly veiled history that doesn't really relate to the game's here-and-now).

That said, there's nothing wrong or bad that I would point to as a reason to avoid, I just wouldn't tell a friend to try this one instead of something else.

24505938.review: The Land of Eyas is very sweet and beautiful game, but very challenging puzzle platformer. Worth every cent! Recommendation!

24481353.review:
I was incredibly stoked when I saw the gameplay video at first, and it only ended up being more fascinating once I got a chance to play the game. I personally love puzzle games, and being able to excel at them after boggling my mind is what interests me the most. This game is definitely a thumbs up.

I won't lie, the game is frustrating if you've never played anything like it before. In my case, I hadn't in a long time, so at first I was struggling to survive. After a while, you become adjusted to the semantics of the game if you're not used to it, and I continue to love the gameplay and travel with the cute and cuddly main character!

24478865.review:
[h1]A 2D Platformer[/h1]
https://youtu.be/i_92oZwGL0g
+ Unique gameplay mechanics. Basically when you jump into water you will submerge flip upside down, and then launch back out.  In most levels you try to get to a high enough height so when you fall into the water you can go deep enough or come back high enough to get to a previously unreachable platform. 
+ Visually the game looks pretty nice, and does a great job of making each level have a unique creative environment with some nice backgrounds. 
+ A nice difficulty curve, meaning that the game is pretty casual and the platforming challenges are not too difficult to solve early on, but gradually get harder as you progress. This is the RIGHT way to make a platformer.
+ Great  soundtrack
+ Cute likeable character

- The story opens up that you are lost and need to find seer stones so that you can find your way home. Unfortunetely, that's about all you get story wise for the rest of the game which is unfortunate as you don't really feel like you are accomplishing much by finishing each stage, and it doesn't tell you how much progress you have made.

24466621.review:
очень прикольная красивая игра - инверсионная головоломка.
рекомендую играть с ребёнком - ему понравится игра.

Мальчик в костюме кошки пытается найти путь домой, но не так просто как кажется найти дорогу обратно. Много опасностей подстерегают на каждом шагу (иногда даже смертельные).
Ищем по миру камешки, а так же выходы их этих миров.

в игре присутствуют достижения Steam и Steam Cloud. а так же поддержка контроллера.
отсутствует русский язык, но он особо не нужен. в игре не так много текста и понятно всё.

24459861.review:
Новый платформер, который почерпнул много положительных черт у похожих игр..
Местами конечно хочется себе глаза чайной ложкой выковырять из-за кричащих цветов, но жить можно.
А так каждый уровень с уникальным дизайном и стилистикой радует глаз.

24458288.review: It's had some major updates since I played the BETA last year. Controls are smooth, graphics are clean and adorable and overall the game is a great challenge with a great price.

24458234.review:
La principal pregunta que debemos hacernos antes de comprar el juego es si no gustan los puzzles y a su vez las plataformas, este juego tiene la combinación perfecta de ambos.

La base del juego es completar los niveles en los cuales deberemos esquivar cosas, recoger llaves para abrir las puertas que nos darán la victoria y muchas veces pensar qué debemos hacer para completar dichos niveles.

El punto fuerte de este juego es el uso de la gravedad para llegar a sitios inimaginables ya sea a grandes alturas o a grandes profundidades, el juego además de los puzzles necesarios para completar los niveles, también tiene algunos secretos que podremos encontrar si exprimimos al máximo cada uno de sus niveles.

Aunque la mayoría de sus niveles son intuitivos cuando ya has jugado varios niveles anteriormente en algunos de ellos tienes que pararte a pensar qué debes hacer o por dónde debes ir que es algo que me ha gustado mucho y hace que el juego no sea monótono a la hora de jugarlo.

La música ambiental me ha encantado, cada nivel dispone de su propia música y consigue que tu aventura sea mucho más épica mientras juegas el juego.

Juego totalmente recomendado si te gusta todo lo citado anteriormente, si teníais alguna duda a la hora de comprarlo, ahora es el momento que con el lanzamiento del juego tiene un pequeño descuento y siempre está bien ahorrarse unos dineros a la hora de comprar algo.

24451599.review: Really fun little game.  Feels inspired by meatboy and fez but takes its own twist with the gravity mechanic.  challenging and cute. The animations for startup and stuff feel a little too longer than they need to be and you cant skip them but with a few flaws that dont affect actual gameplay its definitely a good game

24451336.review: This game is a gem. I definitly recommend using a controller as it enhanced my experience of this title greatly.   I usually play games over steam link and this one looks fantastic on my 60" LCD, I can't tell its being streamed over my network at all.  The controls and physics are truely dialed in, so no complaints there.  The puzzles range in difficulty and I really feal a sense of accomplishment when I solve them.  Some of the puzzle are difficult but the checkpoints are well placed, but also require some strategy to get the most out of them.  Great work guys!

24451199.review:
A fun little puzzle platformer.. though it can get frustrating at times ..sawmill i'm looking at you. 
Cute/interesting art style. I have to say Eyas looks out of place.. it could be in the story.. no clue really.. i skipped it. The story is not what this game is about for me.. it's about hard platforming with interesting puzzles and mechanics , this game does that really well. The platforming feels good and is responsive, the puzzle make you think and it's not always immediately obvious what you need to do. This game is not easy, though not insanely hard. Some levels thankfully have checkpoint so that you don't need to do the entire level again. However the levels are very short but the checkpoint make it more enjoyable for me. There are also par times which you can try to beat, i did find these times ridiculously hard. I stopped trying after the first few levels, but it's there if you like that sort of thing. Some levels also have so called seer stones which you can collect. Music is good.. especially once you arrive in The Net world. 

If you don't like figuring out what to do and dying a couple of times while doing that.. you are not gonna have a good time with this. If you do like a challenge in your puzzle platformer give this one a try.

24450265.review:
[h1]❗ Sobre[/h1]
O jogo The Land of Eyas é um jogo de plataforma com puzzles. Foi lançado no dia 21 de julho de 2016. O jogo foi desenvolvido pela Happy Square Productions , desenvolvedora de jogos sediada na Virgínia, Estados Unidos.

[h1]🎮 Jogabilidade[/h1]
O jogo tem uma bela jogabilidade, pra quem está acostumado com jogos de plataforma, não sentirá nenhuma dificuldade. A área de jogo se divide em duas partes, a metade de cima e a metade de baixo, onde você precisa andar por ambos se conciliando até chegar ao objetivo. O único ponto a se detalhar é que se você estiver indo para o lado e soltar a tecla para andar, o personagem para naquele exato local.

[h1]📝 História[/h1]
Você controla Eyas, perdido e sem lembranças, que precisa voltar pra casa. No caminho você vai coletando fragmentos de memória e vai lembrando o que aconteceu, sem contar as estranhas criaturas que você encontrará que também poderão ajudá-lo a chegar em casa.

[h1]✏️ Gráficos[/h1]
O personagem e algumas fases tem belos gráficos que fazem qualquer fã de 2D se apaixonar, porém nem todas as fases são assim, algumas tem gráficos enjoativos e repetitivos, talvez até nauseantes pelo excesso de tonalidade.

[h1]🎵 Sons/Efeitos sonoros[/h1]
Sons simples, nenhum efeito sonoro fantástico mas todos trabalhados. Se você preferir, pode tirar o som e curtir uma música sua pois não irá interferir no gameplay.

[h1]⚽ Extras[/h1]
O jogo possui conquistas desafiadoras e uma boa quantidade de mapas, quebra-cabeças fáceis e difíceis.

[b]✖️ Não possui idioma em português brasileiro.
✖️ Não possui cartas colecionáveis
✔️ Possui conquistas[/b]

24449339.review: Not too easy and not too hard, graphics are cute, sounds are relaxing and the story is simple. I don't play platformers often since I get bored really fast but this game made me waste about 30 minute on [b]one[/b] level, game mechanics are not hard, they are easy to understand, I didn't get stuck on a puzzle, I got stuck trying to reach the secret. Each level and each puzzle is unique in its own way so I'm pretty sure you won't get bored that fast if you are not a puzzle-platformer fan, if you are however you will probably complete the game in single sitting (the game is not short, its addictive). The game also includes achievements which are not hard to complete but will consume some time. I haven't tested PC controls for the game but they seem to very smooth and responsive on controler. Anyway, the game is great, HSP took their time in Early Access and they delivered exactly what EA supporters wanted and fixed things beta testers complained about.

24447296.review:
Before playing (having not watched the trailer)  i expected a platformer with big levels more like Mario, it's definitely not. 
The basic idea of the levels are that you have "land" above you and water beneath you and you have to gain speed in your jumping (if you jump from a higher place then you will land deeper in the water part and vice versa) and basically keep switching from up to down.
The levels are divided in rooms (like in the Adventures of Shuggy) this makes it you can play some quick round whenever you got some spare time.
The music is very nicely done and very diverse.

Only small tidbit is personally i didn't know what to do on the third and fourth level until i watched the walkthrough posted in the discussion forum as to get an idea on what the game actually expected me to do.
Maybe some more hints in form of a tutorial can fix that.

24446078.review:
The Land of Eyas est un jeu de plateforme qui va vous faire utiliser votre cerveau !

Vous incarner un personnage déguiser avec un costume de chat blanc (celui juste au-dessus)
Le principe est simple, en suivant le fil de l'histoire vous arriver dans différents niveaux où vous devez trouver comment le finir.

Les premiers niveaux sont assez simpes, ils mettent dans le bain, plus vous avancez plus ils auront de pièges et demanderont de réfléxions. Vous devez trouver le chemin que le développeur veut vous faire prendre.

Vous devez aussi trouver des clés pour pouvoir avancer dans le niveau. En plus des clés vous pouvez essayer d'attraper des objets qui feront avancer l'histoire principale (je ne vais pas la spoil et donc ne pas en dire plus)

En conclusion :

Le fond des niveaux est variés et la musique va très bien avec !
C'est un bon petit jeu avec son ambiance où vous aller beaucoup réfléchir, recommencer les niveaux mais aussi et surtout s'amuser a les finir !

Bien sur il n'y a pas de traduction française mais bon, sans lire vous pouvez jouer au jeu !
Et n'oublions pas qu'il s'agit d'un jeu indé !

24445441.review:
The Land of Eyas is a great 2D puzzle-platformer game which requires momentum, quick thinking and dexterity to complete the levels. You play as Eyas, a boy in a cat suit, who lost his memory and needs to solve puzzles with the help, or not, of the gravity to find his way home.
The story is based on collecting seer stones and deliver to the Tree of Ages Past to discover where you are, how you got there and where your destiny lies.

The gameplay is nice, well-made graphics and design, audio is great, smooth controls, easy to pick up and learn but hard to master.

I highly recommend this game if you are a platformer fan.

24444130.review:
First and foremost I hate platformers. Pure platformers that is. I love action platformers. Action Implying there is combat. I especially like Metroidvania style games. This is not that.

However...

This game is cute. Sometimes to cute. It is also very rage inducing. However when you do finally beat a level you feel you have been stuck on forever you feel like you actually acccomplished something. The game isn't as hard as other games in the genre but it is still hard. It also has some pretty unique puzzles.

The biggest thing I can say about The Land of Eyas is that it is most definitely not your average indie 2$ piece of crap platformer. I played 5 hours of the game and for a platformer that is extreme. The art is great, the character is amazing. The levels look good. 

I recommend this for people who like these sort of games. 

Plus it is 10x better than that piece of crap called Recursion. KAPPA!

LumpDizzle666 will be writing the final official review on TheDrastikMeasure.com to make sure you keep an eye out for that!

24443974.review:
2D puzzle platformer, Build completely on a scratch engine (no unity3d ect here),
Gravity, it really will mess with ya head...

truth is I have zero idea how to write a review for this game, since it may come off a biased, Truth be told I spent roughly over a year with the dev in braking and fixing this title, helped on some redesigning parts here and there, an forcing delays to make sure they have near perfect title, and my name is some were in the credits.. 

so having say that, yes I rate 8/10, there’s always room for improvement and some of the suggestion I pointed out will be added in later updates... Having dumped almost 30hs into the title, I personally wish there were more lvls and harder ones to.  

Easy to configure, re-map able keys. Easy to pick up and play, Simple to learn, hard to master. (has speed running goals for those that like to shred of there milliseconds )
Music IMO is great..

Waiting for DLC packs now..

24443620.review:
Hello, i'm Csf91 and i'll be writing this review as i play:

[h1]First impressions[/h1]
Smooth and inmersive music and sound effects, smooth controls and carefully made graphics and design. I love to take a look at details like the water transparency, frogs that run(*jump*) away from you and little details of the game wich show developer's effort to create a inmersive and entertaining game. 


Carefully made games like this one are the ones i'd like to see getting greenlight and releases on steam, because they actually deserve it. Oh, and almost forgotten something very important for this game, wich makes it different from some others, and (from my point of view, very interesting) the gravity switch. Only completed the first level for now, so i'm going to play some more levels and try to improve the review.

[b]For what i've seen, and how smooth and harmony felt within the game, i would give an overall rate of 9/10.

Don't miss this game if you love platform games![/b] :D

PS: I'm actually trying to beat the times and first level was kinda easy as it was like the 'training' but for the second one i'm messing it up (i might not be used to platformer games, but for being able to beat the time, you will have to focus) almost done it pefectly playing with the acceleration and still got a time of 8.30s (time to beat is 7.20, and is more than possible).

For those wondering, what i meant to say with this 'PS' is that from some PoV could seem easy to beat at some levels, but if you want to go for times and beat them, you'll have to play with gravity and getting advantadge of it and the acceleration from falling and that's not [b]THAT[/b] easy! 
:P [b]Again, thumbs up![/b]

24442948.review:
The Land of Eyas is a great game platform format, the character design is great and consists of a boy with cat kigurumi.
In summary the story is based on collecting stones and deliver a mysterious mask to be able to find the home way.

The controls are simple: walk (by directional) and jump (space), but the difficulty of the stages increases when more you advance, making it increasingly game difficult.

Like hard games? try this!
9/10

24442343.review:
The artwork and atmosphere has a mixture of eerie and serene with a dash of cute. Definitely a musthave for any platformer fan in vain of Meatboy or Ibb and Obb. There are very familiar mechanics that make it easy to pick up and learn, but with very challenging levels as the game progresses. 
My only peeve is the running physics. Running full speed and then being able to stop, there is no skidding or slowdown. It gives it a very different feel. 

If you enjoy platformers, I highly recommend this game for your enjoyment and collection.

24442029.review:
Dev gave me this for free. I dislike platformers to the point where I actively avoid them. This one, however, is fun cute and hilarious to watch Eyas die on saw blades. You start to feel bad after the 30th time on one level, though. 

Graphics are fun, little boy in cat suit is cute and the deaths are plenty. There is an interesting story that goes with the game and a fun way to reveal it. The soundtrack, in my opinion, is deceptively relaxing. Eyas isn't your standard run through platformer. It requires dexerity and thinking to progress throughout the game.

24442010.review:
The Land of Eyas is an incredibly charming puzzle platformer from developers Happy Square Productions and Rising Star Games. In fact, I'm particularly happy that RSG picked up this title - there are a lot of interesting titles in RSG's catalogue.

Platformers count amongst one of my most favourite game genres. I've absolutely adored games like [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/k3w3l/recommended/40800/][i]Super Meat Boy[/i][/url] and [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/k3w3l/recommended/238460/][i]BattleBlock Theater[/i][/url], and I definitely feel this game would fill a similar market to those looking for similar games.

You play as the titular character, Eyas, on a journey to find his home. Eyas is this incredibly cute boy in a cat suit, quite adorable. In fact, all of the art assets made here are impeccable - somewhat easy on the eyes, yet at the same time exuding a certain quality and charm to it. [strike]It's kind of a pity that this game does not have trading cards/backgrounds (yet?) as those could definitely be used to showcase some of the artist's more favourite works.[/strike] They've been recently added.

The soundtrack is orchestrated brilliantly as well. Good use of various instruments and song selection for each level stage, with particularly more difficult levels being accompanied by slightly more frantic, yet never overpowering, songs.

As for the levels - they form the bread and butter of the game, and the level design is superb. A good amount of precision platforming and lateral thinking is required to solve the brunt of the levels - some require measured movement while others require well-placed jumps from specific locations. The somewhat unique gravity flipping mechanic comes into play a lot as, for example, you have to ascertain which level you have to jump off from the top side, in order to be able to land at the correct platform after you flip gravity.

I only really have one major gripe about this game, and it's somewhat personal, but - the platforming isn't precise enough for my liking. Unlike most platformers Eyas does not run at full speed whenever he moves, all the time - but instead he has to (somewhat more realistically, I'll admit at least) speed up from 0. I think others shouldn't have much of a problem with it though. It's just that I really demand a lot of precision when it comes to controls, and I often find it easy to move too much in one direction than I intended to.

Ultimately, I really like this platformer game and, again, feel that fans of the other two games I mentioned above would definitely take to this one as well.

[h1]When to buy[/h1]
In all honesty, for the amount of levels present in the game, I thought it would have been priced at $15. Which makes the $10 (without discount) price point rather appealing.

[h1][b]8.5/10[/b][/h1]

24441931.review:

I can suggest this game to everyone , who does like to challange his brain!

You want more information ? Well buy this game and see it by yourself. It cannot be explained with words!
Thanks to the Developer for creating it.

24440168.review:
[table]
    [tr]
        [th][h1] Review	[/h1][/th]
        [th][h1] Score	[/h1][/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Gameplay[/td]
        [td]Very good[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Graphic[/td]
        [td]Nice[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Music[/td]
        [td]Subtle[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Control[/td]
        [td]Clutch[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]Story[/td]
        [td]80/100[/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]

Land of eyas, with its cute and cuddly main character, you would think the game will be kek easy- [b][u] Not even close	[/u][/b]. There was one map where you literally needed to slingshot your body across the entire [strike] fking	[/strike] map, surprising satisfying(and frustrating, que: retries 10 times) once u get it. You play as a cute kid trying to get home and to do that, u got to find seer stones to feed it to the mask guy and go home (oversimplification). 

The game is a combination of super meatball and floating point. First few levels teach you the basics of the game. The difficulty pushes it up a couple of notch after. First up kudos to the dev, the levels are well thought of and are [b][i]really intricate [/i]	[/b]. One good tip from my experience is to [b]avoid[/b] using your up or down key. It’s almost never needed and only serves to confuse you more. Controls are clutch however you do need to predict your character movements when facing obstacle (saws, blocks), you might want to press keys in taps instead of one continuous press, think less is more. Music is very subtle which is a huge plus because it does not annoy you when you die for the ten times. 

The game is a very good production by Happy Square Production, however I might add that I feel there is a somewhat lack of story narrative in the game(could be because i havent gone far into the game yet). [b]  Overall this is a very good game. 9/10. 	[/b]

[spoiler] Edit: I discovered that I’m Buddha, because you need Buddha tier patience. I need a coffee break. 10/10 would pull my hair again.	[/spoiler]
Edit: It's super meatboy, sry bout that.
